1.content:
The entrance to the auction was like a gaping maw. An arched half circle leading inside the main keep, lit within only by magical lamps. The crowds moving to and from through this entrance was a constant, as never ending it seemed as the ocean's tides to the west of the great city. Within the auction was larger than some sizable villages could attest to.

Lining the walls were upraised pavilions and stage-like structures where auctioneers shouted prices and qualities of their wares. Those were the more common of slave, good money for good property... but the center of the huge market was where the truly priceless items were offered. Lit from above by the magical globes, an array of unique slaves were kept under constant guard. The buyers communicated with a wave of their hand, and the barkers never spoke above a guarded volume.

One such seller brought a young girl to stand before the small throng by a chain connected to the collar about her neck. She was dressed in white, pointed ears appearing through her beautiful nut brown hair. "This lovely article hails from the Thistlepath Forests. As you can all see, she is as beautiful as she is untouched. Guaranteed pure, and softer than silk. My starting price is fifteen hundred riol." The elven maiden, barely old enough to hold that title, watched through teared eyes as her life was bartered away. A buyer made the final bid and the girl was led away.

The barker grinned as he held out his hand to the stairs behind him. "As promised, I always have an item to interest you..."
1.title: Welcome to Veru'Vada

11.content:
The other lanes hadn't been as interesting as this center sale. So far every item had been interesting, especially an elven girl from Thistlepath... a forest notorious for its dangers. What could possibly beat out that? She had been an easily acquired prospect... but the tantalizing thought of betters to come had been more appealing.

Money was no object, but a status symbol such as a slave bought at Veru'Vada was something above meager riol. Gold coins were trifles. This was priceless. And as expected, an item of obvious worth was brought forward. The opening bid seemed low for such a creature. Within mere moments it was down to two. One immense bid later and the purchase was complete. "Sold!"

The barker turned to his guards he waved them away saying, "take the merchandise away. The buyer was the..."

111.content:
Jealous glares and angry frowns turned your way as you stood there, thoughtfully doing some math in your checkbook to see how much the purchase would drain your account. You'd spent almost eight thousand riol on this single purchase. But then, considering the item, it was worth the cost to own the being forever.

You ignored the glares and frowns as you moved through the crowd. Humans made up a large portion of the world, so it wasn't unusual for a human to bring some of the big money to an auction. All the same, you could tell that some of the other races had been hoping to win that particular item and were rather annoyed by the results. You muttered apologies and excuses as you moved through to the trading station, where the ownership papers would be signed, the riol would be given, and the necessary preparations would be made to the slave before they were transferred to your ownership.

The man's dark cloak and hood concealed his features. Unusual as it was at the prestigious Vanu'Vadan auction, especially for a buyer of such quality goods. But the man preferred the public anonymity to the occasional recognition. Not that anyone would dare do anything about it, if the knew who he was.
Imperial records listed him as Captain Scales, holder of a letter of marque. He responded to either name. Captain of the Reaver he made a fair profit as a privateer, raiding shipping and collecting bounties on the warships of the Empire's foes. The general public knew him only as a menace. A bloodthirsty monster who's crew had been the terror of the seas for years. Hence the cloak.
It was not the first time Scales had been to a slave auction. Some of his best crewmen were former slaves. And he thought that this new purchase would be a valuable addition to his crew. So he was eager to collect the...

11111.title: Minotaur

111112.content:
The young minotaur looked at the man who had bought her. He was scary, and now she belonged to him. He led her through the city on a leash attached to leather cuffs. His long strides forcing her to trot, hoofed feet clopping along behind his boots. She had no idea what he was, but when he had introduced himself as Captain Scales, the overseer, the huge scarred man tasked with keeping the peace in the slave pens, had gone pale.
She sniffed, her bovine snout taking in the unfamiliar smells of a port city. She sniffed again, this time holding back her tears. She was a long way from the valley were she had lived. A long way from her mother and father and brothers and sisters. But she just had to see what was over the next hill. And that was when the slavers had taken her. Now she didn't know if she would ever see home again.

Scales had excellent hearing. Even over the sounds of the bustling city, he could hear the bovine girl fighting back tears. He nodded to himself. A young one far from home. At least the slave trade had stripped her of the needless bravado all to common in would be pirates. She would survive. She might not like it at first, but she would survive.
He stopped at the foot of a gangplank and nodded at the young lycan that stood next to it. "Is Stavos back yet?"
"No, sir." the lycan looked curiously at the minotaur that was with his captain, hand absently resting on the hilt of his cutlass. "She just left the ship a couple hours ago. Something about finding a decent brothel and..."
"Scales!" A tall muscular woman strode down the dock. "What in the hells did you drag back this time?"
"New crew member." Scales tossed his first mate the lead to the young slave. "Get her a berth and show her around. She should be in weapons." And with that he strode up the gangplank and disappeared.
The sea-woman shook her head at her captain's behavior before turning to the bewildered minotaur. "Well miss I guess I'm the first to welcome you aboard the Reaver. Let's get you aboard and get that leash off of you." Stavos led the girl past the lycan guard, who had returned to scanning the dock. Anyone who wasn't a crew member would be immediately stopped by him. Anyone that tried to overpower him and board would find that there was a large hole in his chest for some strange reason. Lycans were fiercely loyal to anyone who proved their worth, and Captain Scales had earned the loyalty of the pack that was a part of the Reaver's crew many times over. "Do you have a name, girl?"
"Elvira, missus." Elvira looked around, bewildered by the ship. She had never conceived of something like the Reaver and had only vague ideas about the thing people kept calling the sea. She felt a little overwhelmed.
"Sir," Stavos looked over the minotaur. Elvira's legs were covered in a brown fur, but her torso was bare of anything by sun bronzed skin. On her shoulder's was the horned cow's head typical of her race. Stavos looked down at Elvira's wrists, held together by leather cuffs, and noted the hard black nails. The looked to be just as hard as the hoofs and the mino-girl's legs. Stavos also noted that the girl had quite a bit of fat on her. She remembered hearing something about minotaurs, while the bulls looked like the were carved out of stone the heifers carried quite a bit of extra weight. "The proper term of address for a superior on this ship is sir. How old are you, Elvira?" She fired off that last question as a test to see how fast the girl could learn.
"Fourteen years, mi-sir."
At that Stavos stopped and stared. By her estimate Elvira was more than six feet tall, and had breasts bigger than most human woman. And the girl was only fourteen. "Hells girl, how big are you going to get?!"
"My mama is just over seven feet tall, sir."
Stavos blinked, regaining her composure. "Well, Elvira. I'm Alicia Stavos. First mate aboard the Reaver." She turned and waved for Elvira to follow her below deck. "Let's see about getting that leash off and some clothes on you."
"Why do I need clothes, Sir?"
Stavos turned back to stare again. Elvira blinked her big cow eyes. "It's normal to wear clothes where you're from isn't it?"
"Well, yes." Elvira said slowly, "But, it's sunny right now."
Stavos realized how Elvira had such a dark tan. It seemed the minotaur had no inhibitions regarding nudity. And Stavos had an explanation in front of her. "Look, Elvira. It may be different were you are from, but in human society women, and girls," she added taking into account Elvira's age,"Who walk around bare-chested are usually considered to be...whores. So unless you want men who meet you to get the wrong idea, we need to at least get your nipples covered up."

Later, after Elvira had been clad in a loincloth and leather vest, the first mate showed the new crew member around. Stavos wasn't entirely happy with the vest, It had been pilfered from one of the smaller members of the crew and it strained to restrained the mino-girl's chest, drawing almost as much attention as if Elvira had just walked around naked. But the girl had flatly refused a canvas shirt. Stavos, resigned to the girl's whims in this matter proceeded to show her around.
Eventually Elvira asked the inevitable question. "How does this thing move?"
111112.title: Young Cow

1111122.content:
"Twin chaos engines deep in this ships hull power impellers that provide the thrust to move a mass of steel," Stavos waved to take in the Reaver,"The size of a ship. This frees up certain amount of crew for other duties."
"Like what?"
"Manning the weapons and boarding ships of course. We are privateers after all." No one familiar with ships would mistake them for anything else. The Reaver's lean form was all predator. She was built to come in fast and tear her prey of part.
Elvira looked confused, "What do we do?"
Stavos reminded herself of the girls inexperience. "Privateers are a type of bandit, employed by the Empire to attack and harass the ships of her enemies."
"Bandits?" The mino-girl sounded rather alarmed.
Stavos looked at the youngster kindly,"We aren't the nicest of people, Elvira. But we take care of our own. And as of right now, you are one of our own."
The rest of the day passed by uneventfully. Stavos showed the young girl around familiarizing the girl with the massive levin bolt casters affixed to the gun deck for ship to ship combat, as well as the smaller versions in the weapons locker which only the strongest could carry. Stavos watched enviously the ease with which Elvira hefted the small cannons. The girl could definitely be an asset.

The sun fell below the horizon and the rest of the crew returned to the ship. Some wished that the were in the arms of their sweetheart or a well payed whore, but knew better than to tempt fate the night before the Reaver left port. By ones and twos they slipped below deck to rest for the voyage.
Scales looked up from his charts when someone rapped on the door to his cabin, "Come."
Stavos slipped inside. "How much do you know about that slave you bought today?"
"Minotaur, female. Fourteen or fifteen years old. Probably from one of the more isolated valleys in the southern provinces. Why?"
Stavos shook her head. "Why did you buy her?"
"I don't know."
"You never do." Just like when he disappeared when they were kids. Years later he showed up just as she left the Navy saying he had a ship and needed a first mate. He hadn't changed much in the years between. And he was so different from the boy she had run wild with in the capitols streets. "Did you get any special orders this time?"
"Yes, the Republic has finally built itself a Chaos Cruiser. We are tasked to find, disable and, after learning everything we can, destroy it."
"They're sending us on a search and destroy mission? For a warship?" Stavos screeched, "Have they lost their minds?"
"No," Scales rubbed his fingers through his ink black hair, "Deniability. No one is about to get blamed for setting the Reaver on the ship of an ally. After all it is a pirate ship."
"Wonderful," Stavos snarled, "Anything else?"
Scales looked at his old friend, "This is my last voyage."
That stopped her, "Why?"
"I don't know why, Not yet." He played idly with a ball of flame that appeared in his hand. "Only that it is to be."
Stavos sighed, "You and your hells cursed premonitions. And what will happen to the Reaver when your gone?"
"You will be captain. I already confirmed the succession with the lycans." Scales smiled wickedly as his first mate spluttered, "Good night, Alicia."


"Ship! Off the starboard bow!"

"Ah, yes. The felis." The clerk made a note in his book, "Sign here."
A thrill ran up Wyna's spine as she admires her prize. Were Wyna was taller than almost any man she would meet, the young felis was shorter than most human women. Her pelt a deep black that gleamed in the sun. Golden eyes flashed hate at the bare chested man that escorted her out of the pens. Her lithe frame covered by a simple shift that was barely long enough to preserve her modesty, and a plain leather collar around her neck. And she moved with a grace Wyna could not believe no one had recognized when she had been brought to the auction block. She moved with the grace of a trained dancer. Not just any dancer, but as a priestess of the felin's goddess of life. One who had been trained from birth to express herself through the movement of her body.
Wyna had seen a performance by a priestess once in her career as a mercenary. And that had been a special reward for the entire company from a king. She had never forgotten that performance or the way the priestess had moved through out the entire hall
Yes, the young felis was definitely a prize. One that should have been sold in a private auction filled with the richest of nobles. And for far more than a "mere" eight thousand riol.
"What is your name?"
The felis turned her hateful gaze at Wyna. "Baeliss," the last letters drawn into a hiss.
Wyna let the felis' hate roll off of her. She had only bought this prize. But in time she hoped to truly earned it. Turning she beckoned to her new slave, forcing Baeliss to practically run to keep up with her mistress' long striding pace.

111222.content:
Baeliss looked around as she followed her owner. The building was not very impressive from the felis's perspective. If this was the best the freakish human could do it was amazing that she could afford Baeliss at all. Not that the human paid full price for one such as herself. It galled Baeliss that she had been sold as a common female. "Young, reasonably fit. Female." She believed the auctioneer had called out. There had been no mention of her status as a priestess. And from the look of some of the potential buyers the only dancing they saw in her future was to be preformed on her back. Baeliss may have been only sixteen, but she knew she didn't want to lose her virginity as a man's private whore.
"Brokenshield!" A deep voice boomed. The pair turned to see a man striding purposefully towards them. "There you are! The Duchess Dastell wishes to discuss the arrangements for her daughter. She apparently has taken a disliking to me can you believe that." The man stopped just in front of them, a head shorter than Baeliss's owner but just as broad. He looked incredulously at the small felis. "Siri's Sword! Who did you kill to get that?"
"Her name," Brokenshield put the emphasis on the pronoun. She shifted slightly, putting her elbow in front of the slave. "Is Baeliss. And she will be staying with me."
"Baeliss, huh. So is there a chance I can..."
"Jibbinsyn!" A grey haired matron stormed in, "There you are! Milord said you were on laundry detail and gods above you will do laundry." A thick arm snaked out and took the man by the ear. Dragging him away she called over her shoulder, "Wyna dear, Milord would like to speak with you. He's in his study."
Baeliss stood still, nonplussed by the sudden activity around her. Her owner, stepped forward and gestured for the slave to follow. As Baeliss followed she realized that not once had the woman touched her. Baeliss wondered just what kind of person had bought her. They stopped just outside a door that she assumed led to "Milord's" study. Her owner turned to look at her, "While we are in this room do not speak unless spoken to. Understood?" Baelliss nodded.
"You wanted to see me Sir Brian?"
The silver haired knight looked up from his desk. " Ah Brokenshield, yes I did. You have met the Duchess Dastell, yes?"
"Yes, sir." Turning, Baeliss's owner indicated that she could take the unoccupied chair.
"Good what do you think about..." What followed was a rapid exchange that Baeliss could barely follow. It reminded her of the time when she got caught in a ongoing philosophical debate between two senior priests. Both parties knew the subject intimately, and so only half of the conversation was actually said. "Very well. I will arrange for a carriage to take you to their home tomorrow. Who is this?"
Baeliss suddenly found her self the center of attention. She opened her mouth to speak, then clamped it shut remembering her owner's instructions. "This is Baeliss. She will be staying with me."
"How in the world did you afford her? I knew you were frugal, but I had never imagined you has accumulated that much wealth." Sir Brian looked impressed. "I will make sure Lisa knows to send a cot to your quarters. You are dismissed."
"Thank you, sir." Baeliss once more found herself following her master. This time they entered what was clearly someones room. Her master turned to address her. "These are my quarters. You will be staying here with me. Alright?"
Baeliss spoke for the first time since the auction. "Yes, master."
"Call me Wyna." The tall human smiled. "Lisa should bring a cot up soon. I'm going to go downstairs for a bit, can I get you anything? Food? Drink?" Wyna paused, "An instrument?"
Baeliss gasped. How did the human know? Her mind flashed to a beautifully carved flute made from her grandmothers bone. It had been her most prized possession. And know she might never see it again. Wyna, perhaps sensing Baeliss's dicomfort turned to leave. "A flute!" Baeliss said quickly. Wyna turned back. "I play the flute."
Wyna smlied. "I'll try to find a flute."

Some buyers were reluctant to buy the serpentine lad, but some of them were thinking about it, from a man wearing all black robes to a noble business man.

12111.content:
"Thirty-three hundred!" The rich noble says. The whole room goes silent at the idea of someone spending that much for a slave. The man in the leather outfit forfeits, hoping for a fresh, young girl, while the man in the black robes hangs his head knowing he won't be able to outbid the rich, noble businessman.

"Thirty-three hundred! Going Once... Going Twice... Sold! To the Man with the Most Money." The barker congratulates the man. "Now that you own him, here are some the the things about this slave. First off, we keep that muzzle on him to prevent him from biting. Secondly, where this fella came from, his people considered him a prince in their culture." As the barker continued his fact to the Salaket slave's new master, a guard pulls on the chain to guide the slave to another room where the paperwork will be taken care of.

With a few signatures and some paperwork later, a few more guards came in and escorted the Salaket slave back to his master outside. From there, they were escorted through the city to the City Square.

"What is it Mister Greenter?" An escorting guard asks.

"Nothing. It's just that I have a funny feeling like we're being followed." Mister Greenter says as they all look around. The Salaket slaves notices in the distance that just as another city guard is turning a corner out of view, a man behind the corner stabs him with a hidden weapon and pulls him into the corner.

"It's probably nothing." An escorting guard says, not knowing or seeing what just happened in the distance. They continue to the businessman's manor where they stop again. This time, a group of pirates are in the way.

"Out of the way! Out of the Way!" One of the high ranking escort guards commands to the pirates blocking their way. "Now don't make us use unnecessary force." He says as he and a few guards unsheathe their swords. The Salaket slave looks around and sees more of what he say back at the City Square: More people stabbing and dragging the guards away. He continues to look around on the rooftops and sees a glimpse of the Black-Robed Man he saw at the auction house on the roofs. The strange man turns and leaves the view. Back with the escort, the pirates, disband out of the way. "That's better. Maybe you lot can appreciate what we do to protect every citizens." Next thing you know, the escort starts to continue on the path to the rich noble's villa.

A few minutes later, they arrive at the entrance to the walled property of the Noble Businessman's home. They walk through the gate and as the Salaket slave looks around at the other slaves maintaining the property and working in the fields of sugar cane. They continue their way to the back of the property and towards the Slave Quarters where some slaves who have done their work are relaxing and eating and drinking. There are many slaves including a dragon slave and a kobold slave, and other races.

"I believe this is where you come in Slave Master." The noble businessman says to the high-ranking guard from the escort.

"I will do what I always do." He says as the businessman turns back to his villa. "You two," he commands to two guards, " Hold him down." Those words are infamous to the other slaves as some of them gasp in horror at what's about to happen. The two guards hold the Salaket slave and bend him over. The Slave master pulls a branding iron from the burning fire pit as he presses the hot piece of metal against the skin of the Salaket. The slave cries in pain as he is unable to scream thanks to the metal muzzle prevents him from opening his mouth. As the slave master removes the branding iron, he puts it in a container full of water and back into the fire pit. "All done," he says as he lowers his head to the still crying slave's face, "Wasn't that quite lovely?" He asks as if this was a sick game to him. Then the noble businessman comes back as he tells the slave what to do.

1212.content:
"...noble. More than a noble in fact, this one was a king! A king in his native and barren land."
The noise of the crowd immediately rose into a crescendo of furious bidding. Imagine, not only the noteriety of being able to actually have bought from the Veru'Vada auction but to have bought royalty! To have a king wipe your arse if you so demanded it! It was too much for many to pass up! Scuffles broke out within the crowd as bids were cast and then instantly outbid. The price steadily climbed as the bidding raged on.
Then one voice rose above the others with what seemed like an impossible bid - a good twenty times the amount of the last one. The crowd grew quiet as people looked for the owner of that voice. It belonged to an older man adorned in the rich robes of a foreigner.
The barker barely lost a beat as he then challenged the crowd to top the foreigner's bid. "Surely there is one among you here that will not allow a foreigner to walk away with so rich a prize uncontested!" But there were none and the barker was forced to close the bidding with a booming, "Sold!"
The foreigner quietly walked up to the auction block and took the slave's collar chain in his hand and led his property off through the crowd. The barker immediately got the mob going again with his next item for sale, promising it to be even better than the last.
"Are you well my prince?" the foreigner asked his slave when they were clear of the crowd. "I can't imagine they would have treated you too awfully in the household of his almighty, the ruler of Riatin." He paused, "Were you successful?" He handed him a key.
"Yes," the slave answered, unlocking the collar with the key he'd been given. He smiled. "He called me 'king', though I am only a prince."
"But your son will be a king."
"Yes he will." The prince's smile broadened. "The queen of Riatin is pregnant"
1212.title: Prince

12122.content:
The prince asks, "Did you bring clothes for me?"

The foreigner answers, "I am sorry my prince. Your father has spies everywhere."

The prince asks, "Even here in Veru'Vada?"

The foreigner answers, "No, but in the castle of Riatin and in strategic locations where he expects Prince Nalon to be found."

Prince Nalon walks to the edge of the road and looks out over the fields. He squints his eyes. "So, Kolim, are we finished?"

Kolim stops and puts his hand on the prince's shoulder. "No, my prince. Only delayed. Your father is doing what he can to ensure your brother gets the throne. He will kill you if he finds you but he still expects you to try for your brother's throne. He would never predict this ploy for the throne of Riatin. His spies are in military installations to keep you from raising an army. His spies are not in slave markets to keep you out of a queen's bedchamber."

Prince Nalon laughs and they resume walking. "So all we have to do is wait for a chance to kill the king of Riatin. My son will be too young to rule and the queen will appoint me regent. She prefers me over her husband anyway."

Kolim says, "Yes, but we must proceed with caution. If you show up at the castle as a prince, your father will kill you. If anyone suspects your infidelity with the queen, the king of Riatin will kill you. You must stay in disguise."

Prince Nalon shudders, "I wish it could be otherwise. Can you think of any disguise other than a slave?"

"No, my prince."

Prince Nalon stops walking. Then he puffs up his chest and sighs and resumes walking. "Very well but I will tell you how we are to proceed. You will enter the service of Riatin, something domestic that keeps you away from the military portions where my father's spies are. You will take me in as your slave but then sell me to the king as a domestic slave. Try to position me in the bedchamber. They will then dress me in a uniform that will cause the spies to not look at me. It will also position me to be ready when the time comes for the king to die."

"It is a risky plan but I believe it will succeed, my prince."

"But if it is to succeed, you must stop calling me prince."

Despite the collar's influence, a series of short hisses passed through Sava's lips. She was giggling, but only the guard took notice. He looked ready to strike but no blow fell. "Of course, your grace. We hope to see you again in a year's time."

"Indeed." The guard returned to the block at that, leaving Sava standing alone and barely clothed under many pairs of eyes. She did not waver, but stood tall... even flaunting herself slightly. She had claws, a tail with dusky scales that ran up over most of her back and rear... there were even small spikes lining her spine. But, despite all this, her body was for lack of a better term... perfect. She had every right curve, slim and trimmed in all the best spots. Slender and sightly, she was indeed as beautiful as proposed.

Even though at that moment Sava's collar held her immobile and docile, what with her wings drooped and tail slumped haphazardly on the ground... despite it all she was no passing sight. "I see the tales were not simply that, but true. She is a marvel."

"And vicious as they say, my lord. She may look calm, but there is fire behind those dragon eyes." The man who spoke immediately stiffened as Sava's piercing sapphire eyes fell on him. The hair-line pupil widened slightly as she focused, reading his breathing and perspiration. This man was afraid. They all were... all but the one they called their lord. He stood impassive; she could hear his steady heartbeat and his calm breaths. Despite the facades of bravado he had around him, this man had true courage.

Sava had to check herself, did she find an inkling of respect? No... it had to be the collar. This man had just, for all rights, bought her soul. The confounded collar was even trying to make her want it! Almost on queue with her thoughts, the lord spoke again. "Do not look so pitiful. You are a proud creature, appear so." There was freedom in those words, that of movement. Stiff muscles creaked as the collar unlocked them, sore joints worked out kinks as Sava stretched. Her barely clothed body moved as fluidly as a cat's as she loosened herself. The sight drifted further from the norm as Sava lifted her wings to sit comfortably furled, her tail lifting off the ground to sway behind her.

She could almost smell the different thoughts floating through the air. She ignored the lusting glances, keeping her gaze on the lord. If she was to serve, it had damn well better be someone worth her attention. "That's better. Come, it is a long journey to your new home." He simply motioned after that, once again offering the freedom for Sava to move on her own. She stepped forth lithly, bare soles pattering on the stones as she followed.

A man even tried to take hold of the chain, the means for absolute control... but a glare from Sava's new master made the servant immediately drop it. "Be sure to have that chain removed as soon as possible. It is unsightly."

"But my lord, it is part of the control collar!" One man complained, audibly squeaking.

"I doubt there will be issue. Will you prove a problem if I do this?" He had asked her a direct question. Sava blinked... unsure for a moment before glaring at the squeaker.

"No... my master," she said in a voice that barely registered above a growl. She had not heard her own words in so long. She made sure they were edged like a sword at squeaker, she didn't know the next time she could use her tongue for more than tasting her food.

"There... I knew I should have brought my knights. You lot are making yourselves look like fools." The group continued on as Sava took a spot just behind and to the right side of her master. She felt curious hands tap at her tail, wings, and brave ones at her spines even... but none for more than a moment. She ignored these, deciding instead to watch this lord as he led the group to wherever their destination was. He held himself high, spoke little, and was as mindful of her as she was of him. He didn't even need to glance at her for her to know he was examining her. He used his ears, but that's all that was required.

This was a very interesting man. Again Sava mentally slapped herself, she would not give into the collar's influence so easily. The slavers had not broken her, and neither would it. She removed herself from the mental reprimand as the group reached a caravan just inside the city's second inner wall. The lord waved a man over and spoke in a hushed whisper. His words may have been low, but Sava heard just fine. "We will return a different way than we came. I know how some of these slavers operate. Make haste."

"My lord," the man spoke with a bow of his head. The group all moved to mount a number of horses as a wagon of some type was loaded with a multitude of items and objects. "My lord... the slave, how will we transport her? We did not bring a spare horse and the wagon is full." This illicited an audible growl from Sava's throat. The thought for her to ride in any way on a creature she would sooner eat alive then consider of any other use.

"A horse? Are you mad, she would frighten it." The lord spoke as if he were scolding a child. "She has wings, she can use them. Unless they are just for show." Excitement like icy thunder swept through Sava's veins. Would he allow her? She instantly spread her wings to full and hunch slightly, as if waiting for the go ahead. "You see? She knows herself well, we should not doubt that. Fly, and follow us from above."

No sooner had those words fallen from the lord's lips did a blast of air spread over the whole group as Sava took off with sleek form. Her wings spread to full once more as she caught an updraft and soared. At that moment she didn't care if it was the collar or not. She liked this master, if even a little bit. Shed been grounded far too long, and it was like a wave of relief flushed through her at the feeling of wind and air all around. This was where she belonged.

Watching her fly high above, the lord grinned. "What a magnificent creature."

"My lord... what exactly do you intend to do with it? It is not as if she would serve as a kitchen slave."

"You worry too much. I have not yet decided on a definite purpose for her. Though it will be one that suits her unique... heh... abilities. That is for certain."

1223212.content:
The night fell quickly. Fires were lit all about the halted caravan as men and women sat about them, eating and talking. Laughter sometimes echoed through the starry sky, with guards posted the group was much without care. The lord sat in silence by his lonesome, simply watching the fire before him crackle and snap. He thought much about what this journey had brought him. Three months gone was too long, but the necessity had forced such measures. With the sickness amongst his people, it had been his responsability to make sure it was safe.

The dragon girl... she had simply been an item he was too fascinated to pass on. He turned only his head to look at her wispy form perched upon the caravan's supply wagon. She was statuesque, only moving every moment or so to sniff the air or look around. He could tell she made the horses nervous, but they did not complain. The stories he had heard of the dragonkin were many, though few rang true it seemed. Creatures born of dragons and other races seemed impossible. The great beasts did not even allow small camps within their territories, sooner raining fire from the sky than "lesser" races stay amongst them.

"My lord," a voice broke him from his reverie. Several of the lord's charges sat amongst his fire, bringing with them food and drink. "You must be hungry, sir."

"Indeed I am." He took the plate and cup, again casting a glance to the winged girl. "Such a remarkable being. I confess my interest in her was more marvel than practical. Now though..." he seemed to pass once again to thought, leaving a silence long enough for discomfort to follow.

"Though this is true, my lord... what possible use could you have for such a creature? She is untamed, unnatural. She would sooner rip out your throat and drink from your veins that serve as a slave."

"You know my dislike of that word, Greigen."

"My apologies, sir. But the truth remains as said. She is vicious and wild."

"That is what interests me so. She is a mystery. As feral as she acts and appears, do you not see the intelligence coiling behind her eyes. She proved she can speak and understand, that alone disproves rumors enough about her kind." Two pricks of soft blue glow were aimed towards the lord as he looked to the dragon girl again. Sharp ears she had, likely having heard everything. With a wave of his hand the lord summoned her.

She leapt from the wagon into the dark, vanishing until the fire's glow illuminated her once more. She sauntered, bare feet making barely a rustle through the grass as she sat down by the fire. All eyes now locked on as she gazed into the flames, face almost reminiscent. "Have you eaten?" The lord's question seemed to take aback several of his companions, but one in particular just grinned. The others were new to the service of his lord, they did not know of his actions seemingly unbecoming a lord of the empire.

The dragon girl just stared at the lord, then at the plate in his hand. Cooked pheasant and greens with a cup of ale. She visibly grimaced. "I take it that you eat something different then?" She simply gazed out into the dark. Language built on subtle motion more than words, that action alone spoke tales. "Go find your dinner then and return." Like a ghost the girl hissed and leapt over the fire and into the night. Several men shouted in surprise, falling back from the puff of air turning the flames at them. As the laughter from the others died down, a sharp cry came the darkness.

All attention was to the inky black all around, the sounds of a struggle were coming from nearby. Sharp hisses, a yelp, then something like a shrieking howl filled their ears. "Seems she'd had her eyes on something beforehand." The lord was as collected as ever as he took another bite from his plate. "Her senses are sharper than I thought." It was if it were the most normal thing in the world as a dead creature dropped with a thump next to the campfire. This was followed quickly by its killer, bloody claws still dug into the flesh.

"A badger? She killed a badger..."

"Hah! Was that your yelp we heard then?" One man chuckled as the dragon girl looked down at her kill, then back at the lord. It was as if she were waiting.

"I believe she is waiting for your say-so, sir. The collar is meant to control such baser instincts." The girl snorted, looking at the speaker like one would an ignorant child before whipping her attention back to staring at her master.

"Or are you waiting because that is your nature? You may eat." Without a moment's hesitation the girl dug her razor teeth into the dead animal's flesh. She spat away the skin and fur before plunging into the bloody meat beneath. Ripping a mouthful from the corpse she threw her head back and gulleted the bite before repeating again and again. Her mouth and chest were already soaked in blood, but this only seemed to make her more frenzied in her meal.

The men watching her had a mix of horror, fascination, and disgust as devoured her kill like an animal. small drops of blood were thrown into the fire, making the coals hiss in response. "Well... little can be said for manners."

"Does she even chew?"

"She eats like a dog."

"Enough." A wave of his hand and the lord silenced the others.

"My lord, to say it would takes even weeks to properly train this... animal... what more use could you have for her than as a pet? She is as wild as a beast." All eyes fell on Greigen. It was one matter to speak freely when around the lord, but to openly rebuke in such a way drew a long silence. Even the girl stopped her ravaging and glared at him, mouth still hidden in her kill's flesh.

"For that thinking, I have little to no intent to... 'train' this girl. I did not purchase her rights to crush the instincts and spirit that make her what she is. I do not desire a pet or a slave, as you would so elegantly put it. I have plenty of both and have no need nor want for more. I do not know how you handled the hands within your household... but when you are in my presence, and under my authority, you will stay your tongue from questioning my judgment. Let your words stray again, and it will be claws and not a rebuke to silence you." The dragon girl licked blood from her lips at the mention of what no one doubted were her talons.

With a confused and frightened expression, Greigen looked to the dirt and remained silent as the grave. The remainder of the night went by quickly. The lord retired to his tent once his meal was finished, opting for a pair of guards and the dragon girl to keep watch. Every so often the guards would see her slinking about in the dark, walking on all fours and keeping low, ready to pounce at a moment's notice.


The last legs of the journey flew by, quite literally at some times. Sava, while wary at all times, had come to honestly question if her collar was the source of the growing respect she bore for her master. Granted, she was compelled to obey his every command... but she started to wonder if without it would be any different? He acted much like Mire had amongst her brothers and sisters, the alpha. His word was law, and this lord held himself just as the lead brother would.

Freedom was allowed, but his authority even to a single word was absolute. There was no question nor hesitation in obediance to an alpha, the most capable of the patriach's kin. The lord, Sava's master... he was her alpha now. She was there not by her choice, but she steeled herself by the fact that it was still her decision to whom she could look to for guidance.

Her master was a strong and capable man, and despite him not being of the patriarch's kin... she would follow him. She knew this was not the collar's doing, but her own. The choice was made. Looking down from her lofty glide, sava watched the specks that were the caravan moving along the road. Many leagues further along the same path, a pass through a range of mountains could be seen. She knew from listening to nighttime voices that that was where the lord's home resided.

Banking and diving swiftly to the ground, Sava landed hard on the wooden back of the wagon, startling the horsedriver. He scowled at her, but otherwise kept to his duty. Soon enough a large group of armored men rode up to greet the caravan, taking their places alongside as escorts. Leading into the pass was not a sight of awe for Sava as it was for others. High rocky walls, crags, and the likes were where she had called home. In fact, it was a welcome thing to be again amongst the cold embrace of rock once more.

As the caravan and escorts passed through the massive gates at the opening to the valley, Sava contented herself with her wagon perch and watched with intensity. This was to be her new home, and some small part of her was curious. What surprises were held for her within were a mystery, but she would meet them head on. This was her only rule.

12232121.content:
Past the gates to the valley was hardly what Sava expected. There was a great town, with buildings and cottages, markets and stables along the winding road up into the mountain. The city she had just left had been massive, but this place was no small group of huts. What impressed though was at the top of that mountain sat a fortress. Towers and walls, bastions and culverts that gave the image of raw power. Despite banners and colors flying from towers and hanging from the walls, the feeling of solitude resounded through the entire valley. This was a place made to seperate from the outisde.

As the caravan passed over the main road, people of all ages stopped their work, children stopped their play, and all stood to watch the passing of their lord. Weary faces, tired souls... all prepared for a hard day's labor and yet they called and greeted their ruler with smiling faces and excited words. What interest this brought in Sava faded as her eyes locked on some goats and her stomach growled. The goats saw her too, flitting about nervously as they sensed a predator.

The thought of food was enticing, but Sava was more enthralled by the high arches passing above her as they approached the keep. The arches had towers at each end, and along them were lined many men. This place was well defended. Wise to guard one's home however possible, Sava could relate to such thought. Then again her home was protected by a pack of vicious and merciless dragonkin, not swords or bows. Still, the defenses were admirable.

Though it occured to her, Sava paid little mind to the number of eyes following her. Curious children pointed, men and women stared... and even a few guards knocked arrows. Keeping to her seat Sava simply grumbled and snuffed as she took in sights and smells. She was already quite used to stares, and she was hardly going to let it bother her. This place smelled differently than her mountain home. Smelled of fire and metal, animals and people. She caught hints of flowers, grass, even trees... but they were almost overpowered. The smells of man were all around, but unlike the city they bled into more familiar scents.

Before she even realized she was lost to the surrounding smells, the caravan had climbed the winding path and passed through the gates of the keep. The thick walls rose high into the air, honeycombed by windows, stairs, and the doors they led to. But in front of her, Sava looked out at an immense courtyard. The path to the keep's door was lined by trees, as if they had built the fortress around a forest. At the end of the short wooded path was the keep's inner door, and a small group awaiting the approaching horses.

A young child seemed the most anxious as she tugged on the arm of the woman beside her. As the lord's horse pass through the wooded path the girl broke away, excitement in every crease of her joyous expression. "Father!" In turn the lord leapt from his horse and lifted the young girl in an embrace. The woman ran forward and latched to the man as well. Sava knew a family when she saw one, but snorted at the open affection. There had no need for such displays amongst her own.

"Welcome home, you were successful?" The woman asked.

"Medicine and supplies. I dislike having needed outside aid, but the deed is done." The lord waved to a waiting guard and the man ran over and gave a swift salute. "Make sure these supplies reach our clerics. They know more than I on how to use it."

"My lord." The man bowed his head only a moment before shouting for hands to carry what the wagon held. Sava took this as a good time to dismount, landing with barely a sound on the stone ground. She flapped her wings once for measure and furled them behind her. The sudden silence was enough that Sava knew all eyes were... again... on her. No one spoke, though more than one gasp had been uttered by the women in the group of greeters.

It wasn't until a shrill but musical laugh filled the air did anyone even twitch. "Big lizard!" The young girl squirmed from the lord's arms and dashed right at Sava. Her mother shrieked for the girl to stop. She did not, opting instead to run between Sava's long legs and wrapping her entire body around the swishing tail. "Big lizard lady!" The presence of a child. Attached to it did not even slow the leisurely sway of the tail. In fact, the only thing it did was fill the air with more laughter. "Swing me!"

"Get away from that... Mearza come back this instant!" The lord held his wife back from charging headlong at Sava with a single large hand. It was instead a young man who approached. He was well dressed, like the others... no doubt another of the lord's children. He bore a sword at his waist, but made no move to draw it. He simply walked until coming within arm's length of Sava and stopping.

She looked him right in the eyes. Yes, this youth was with no questioon the son of her master. He had the same calm, steeled courage as his father. He hid no fear because there was none to hide. "Mearza, she is not a plaything. You are frightening mother, come along."

"No! Swing me faster!" Sava's eyes suddenly blinked twice as the collar took over. She grimaced as her tail began to swing left and right, taking the young man by surprise as he stepped back to avoid the tip. The child's mother panicked as she saw her daughter swing like from the end of a whip, cackling with glee as she swooped through the air.

Sava on the other hand knew if her powerful tail truck anything, the child would be crushed. Her heart beat with adrenaline as she fought to regain control, but her legs were locked and her tail swinging faster and faster. In the end she could think of only one thing, she grabbed the collar with both hands and tried with all her might to remove it.

There was a mechanism in the magic seal of the collar. It was a punishment for trying to remove it, and with full knowledge Sava activated it. The swinging ceased as she collapsed to the ground with a cry of pain, convulsing as wave upon wave of agony tore through her body. Now even the lord was running up, kneeling over Sava as she shook, pulling her limbs to her chest in the futile attempt to ward away the pain.

After a few moments the punishment ceased, leaving Sava shuddering on the cold stones. Tears poured from her eyes despite how tightly they were shut. She managed to open one slightly, peeking out of the corner of her eye up to see her master and his son looking at her and confused as for what to do. They spoke, but her mind was reeling. She could not comprehend their words. With one final shiver, she fell into blissful unconsciousness.


"What happened?"

"She tried to kill my baby, that's what happened!"

"Mother... Mearza gave a command, don't you see she's wearing a control collar? She had no choice but to obey."

"Do not scold me like a child, Tristan! I am your mother still!"

"But the boy is correct, Nanya. I'm sorry, I should have sent prior word of my return... and with what I returned." Lady Nanya took a moment from cradling her daughter to smack her husband on the shoulder.

"Like how you were bringing home a monster! An enslaved one to make matters all the worse! You swore off slavery despite being a lord of the empire. You take the time now to fall back on your word?!"

"I have no intention of falling back from anything, my dear. I just witnessed something remarkable."

"Your daughter being flung like a rag doll by the tail of some... creature?! She could have been killed!" Nanya's voice was quickly shifting from fearful to enraged. Though another voice, calm and collected, spoke exactly what was needed.

"She knew she couldn't fight the collar so she tried to remove it. All those who wear the collar of a slave know the consequence of trying to take it off, but the pain it inflicts would also halt anything she was doing. She did that on purpose."

"On purpose?"

"She inflicted incredible pain on herself to safeguard Mearza. I've never seen someone willfully do that." The lord turned Sava's head towards him to look at her face. It was no longer locked in an expression of agony, but the calm of sleep. "She looks human... she may have even been once if rumors speak true. I purchased her rights out of sordid curiosity even after swearing never again to enslave another. But I still felt compelled to do so." Even Nanya was quieted by the lord's words. He looked carefully at the dragonkin's face, noting the age she appeared. A child barely older than his son, it was a crime for her to be forced into a life not her own.

Still... the danger she presented was not lost on him. "Father, allow me to tend to her for now... unless you had other plans," Tristan asked, kneeling beside Sava as well. The lord pondered for a moment, then nodded in agreement. Sliding his arms beneath her, Tristan was sure to collect up her tail as he lifted her off the ground. She was lighter than he expected, but still weighted enough to be a burden. "What will we do with her now then?"

The lord thought hard about that as he stood. She had willfully harmed herself to keep young Mearza from harm... and she had been wholly obedient to him. But, had that been the collar or had she done it willingly? He couldn't know for certain...

It was best to leave it on, at least till he could be sure. The more pressing matter at hand was thus...

What was to be done with her?

122321211.content:
Held down, tied in chains, the fierce blows rattling bone, shouts and curses, another strike rousing from fitful sleep... no escaping the chains, the cold of steel and bite of metal. Wings bent, arms sore, tail bound... unable to move. Another blow, a kick to the nose, blood... red blood... blood everywhere.

With a snarling hiss Sava shot upright, baring fangs and claws as she shook off the dream. Her breathing was hard and ragged, droplets of sweat beaded on the scaleless portions of her skin. She couldn't remember the dream, but she did recall the fear and the pain. As the adrenaline lessened, she let out a long breath that growled from her throat. It was unbecoming to allow a dream the power to dictate her actions. Sava had been kept awake many a night amongst her kin before truly learning that.

As she felt calm over her again, she took in her environment with as much caution as confusion. Where was she? She was covered by sheets of cloth, and was on top of something soft and pliable. Bed and blankets... she could barely remember but knew those were their names. She stepped off the bed and wandered to the center of the room, taking in the bits of furniture and other arrangements it contained. There was even a small fireplace lit and crackling at the far end.

Sava remembered now what had happened. The young girl, and then the pain. It was a bad memory, and not one to dwell on. Instead Sava focused on the fire, the familiar flicker of flame and crack of embers. She lost herself so deep she did not notice a knock. The door opened as someone poked their head in. "She's up." A young man's voice. Sava turned and watched the son... Tristan as she recalled his name to be, as he entered.

He too noticed Sava and grinned, his mouth apparently moving faster than his eyes. "I'm glad you're awaaaoa..." his voice split off as he covered his his face and turned away. "Awake, and naked... um, yes, ahem... unclothed. Um, sorry, there are garments in the drawer there." He pointed to a wooden chest and Sava just stared. They were going to put more cloth on her? Cloth itched and bugged, it kept the wind from whistling through her scales. "If you don't mind, please be a bit more, ah, modest."

The collar remained quiet, but Sava did as she was asked. Within a moment she had pulled on two shirts, a pair of trousers and a dress, none of which were on the correct parts of the body for which they were designed. Sava just grumbled and Tristan uncovered his face only to immediately burst out laughing. "On your head?" He was drawn back into another fit of laughs at Sava's appearance. She growled, unsure as to what exactly was so humorous. "I, ahem, I take it you do not clothe yourself in such a manner from where you hail."

"No." She muttered as he pulled the dress from her wing. Though the moment she did speak he froze.

"You... you spoke."

"Yes."

"You can talk?"

"Yes."

"Well, can you say more than just yes or no?"

"... Yes."

"Now you are just making fun." Sava simply blinked, her expression confused. But like that it vanished as the almost everpresent scowl returned. "Well, you've been asleep nearly all day. I brought you to my spare quarters so you would not be bothered. Now though; my mother is wishing to see you and you have to be at least partially presentable."

Tristan tried to pull the dress over Sava's head, but she just snorted and lifted up her wings to get in the way. "You've already proven your impecable skill at dressing yourself, or lack thereof. Just hold still and let me put something on." The collar confirmed the command and Sava went limp, all except her legs. Tristan took instant note and scowled himself. "Despicable things, I hate them."

It was quickly discovered that even without her being stubborn, Tristan could not get anything down over Sava's head past. her wings. Finally, in exasperation he cut the back from a pair of trousers and wrapped her chest in a ripped sheet. "Well... you are dressed as a miner, but it is better than the rags we pulled off you. I'm afraid the only shoes I have are boots though."

"No shoes." Sava found she was still able to speak, the collar was not being so picky.

"What? What do you mean no shoes? You just go barefoot?"

"Yes." The collar had ceased its hold, and Sava simply scraped her feet against the floor a few times. "Strong."

"I think some would be more worried about dirt." With a smirk Sava spread her wings a little.

"No dirt in sky. Floor clean, clean feet a lot. No shoes." While the collar could compel her to respond perfectly, when under her own power Sava's words were barely those of a child. It was Tristan's turn to smirk.

"Oh this will certainly be interesting." Again met with a confused look, Tristan motioned to follow. Sava knew her inaptitude for speech was a handicap, but at least she could understand others. How though was something not even she fully understood. Once again, she thought of the collar and snorted. "Ah, I think it best not to, um, make that sound for a while. My father spent the better part of the day listening to my mother rant of throwing you to the wolves. Such noises may be less than convincing of you not being an animal."

As they walked through the halls, Sava took in the sights as she always did. Carpeted floors, high ceimings and walls covered with art and decorations. "Colors..."

"Yes, this wing contains much of the art and other items a keep "must have' as my father's advisors say. Such is the nature of things I imagine. This is also where my family and I live, opposite the side where business of the state is conducted." He barely retained any of Sava's attention as she peered out passing windows. She more wondered whether other kin lived in the high peaks than what was what in a giant stone fortress. As big as it was, she felt awfully stifling. She needed open sky, room to hunt, and speaking of which she felt her stomach growl again. This was not the time, and she ignored the hunger.

Approaching a large door, Sava watched as two armed men opened them to a great hall. An enormous wooden table sat in the center astride an almost equally large fireplace. Standing before the blaze was the lord and his wife. The uproar Tristan had claimed she was in must have died down greatly for she was speaking softly, and without anger. "I know you say you meant well, but you further serve to fund their trade."

"If not I than another. There is no slowing the trade of life in the empire, Nanya. But at least I do not condone the governing of life as do others."

"I know this, my lord. But..." her voice trailed away as she saw her son and the being in question approach. "But she is as you said, one of the Dragonkin. They are a brutal and feral kind, my lord! They are raised among dragons, fight to live every single day. Are not these traits of animals?" This brought a rumbling hiss from Sava's throat. The light of the fire danced in her eyes as she looked from Nanya to her master. "You see? No human nor elf nor any mindful being would make such a sound. Why it is by the very device you despise that she remains docile enough to exist among us!"

"I have my doubts on that."

"As you have said again and again! Well I have doubts also! One that you would, in right mind I add, suggest such a creature serve as a guard for our only daughter!"

"I have many enemies, my love."

"Do not so leisurely use that word to me when making claims bordering the insane. Why else are we guarded day in and day out? Why else is there an army of soldiers posted at all times on and within a wall built to withstand giants? I know of your enemies. I have met one." Turning away, Sava caught glimpse of an ugly scar on the woman's exposed shoulder. "I am more concerned for the harm that could be left on my baby."

"Mother, she purposefully tortured herself to keep Mearza from harm."

"Yes, I am aware. That is the only reason my mind has even a chance of sway. The thought of it, she likely does not even have a name amongst her kind."

"Sava." The word was more a growl, but a word nonetheless came from her lips. "Sava."

"She can speak?"

"Sava, a good name." The lord looked as pleased as Sava felt from the praise. "Perhaps then she can speak for herself." All eyes then turned to the dragon girl as she looked again into the fire.

"Words not good. Taken from kin... collar put on, hit lots, no food." Her body language seemed to fill in what gaps were left by her words. By the sound of her voice, they could all tell hers was not one often used. "Found by master... let fly, hunt... be free. Still have collar, but for keep nice. Master give freedom, I follow." The one word that held all the meaning was just that. Freedom.

With that in mind, Nanya turned and lost herself in thought.
122321211.title: Unaccustomed

1223212111.content:
To think I would be faced with such a thing as this," Nanya muttered more to herself than anyone else. "I still reel from the thought of allowing her to live here at all."

"I am the one who decided it without consultation. If there is anyone to blame it is I. There is no need to throw her to the wolves."

"She might be an enigma for us, but think of what that would mean for father's rivals. I've had a thought from that," Tristan spoke confidently. "Father is the target for assassins from many of his fellow lords because he has renounced tradition. They cannot deign themselves to believe he would entrust his life to a slave, no matter the one held by a collar." As he crossed his arms, the young man gave a sly glance to Sava as she remained transfixed on the blaze before her. "It would be unexpected indeed, but what if we allowed her to act as a protector?"

"So you suggest we simply put our lives in the hope she honors loyalty? Loyalty to those who pay gold for the rights to a life?"

"As much as I cringe to voice it, the matter is she has little choice. We could remove the collar, but without any prior knowledge on whether doing so would unlock whatever aggression is inhibited, the results could be disasterous." All eyes, even Sava's, were on Tristan now. "She herself said it kept her passive. As much as I hate myself for saying it, we should consider all options before choosing one."

"So we stoop once more to the very ideals we swore off. All for your damnable curiosities. Even your own son must come to your defense."

"You make it sound as if I am trying to rationalize for myself and am dragging our children with me. No, I would never do that. Whatever reason or force behind my going into the Veru'Vadan market aside, it is no mere whimsy or crude fancy I came to bring this girl with me." The lord's collected tone brought the tension that had filled the room to a lull.

"It is infuriating how you always see the greater good sometimes. How aggravating your ideals can be." With a hand covering her mouth in deep thought, Nanya stared as Sava sat down in front of the fire and curled her tail and wings about herself. The look of her as she enjoyed the warmth was almost endearing. "I am not swayed... but I can see what about her it is that you are so moved by. For all her image, I can't help but see a child trapped beneath scale and claw. I cannot in right mind enslave a child."

"No child." Sava's voice was clear. "Maybe once... no more." She turned her head from the fire, blue eyes sparkling as if from their own inner light. "With collar... without... still a slave. Slave to humans, or slave to patriarch. Doesn't matter. Still a slave." This simple statement left all others silent. Sava just turned back to the fireplace and silence once again.

"What do you mean, always a slave?" Tristan voiced what everyone was thinking. "And who, or what, is patriarch?"

"Too much talk. Always talk. Leave alone." In two simple words, Sava had summed up enough longing, sadness, and loneliness to be near palpable. She put on a strong front, but the shock she'd been through had opened a floodgate. There was still a girl underneath, just as Nanya had said. The lord understood and motioned to his wife to walk with him.

"Come, let's go and see to Mearza for now before something is lit aflame... again."

"I do not see this discussion as closed."

"Nor do I, but I think it best we leave it in our son's more capable hands. Of anyone, he is the most understanding in matters such as these." After a skeptical glance Nanya agreed. The two rulers quietly left the great hall, leaving only the youth remaining in company. Sava watched out of the corner of her eye as Tristan sat on the floor, much like her, before the fire. He was a few paces away though, and silence fell for a lengthening time.

It was calming. Just the wispy cracks of the wood and coals, embers aglow through the long fireplace. To most such a lull would be disheartening, uncomfortable. To Tristan it was as peaceful as the sound of lapping waves over rocky shores. Minutes passed without so much as a word or move from either of them, not until Tristan turned himself to sit facing the dragon girl. She only turned her eyes to meet his, expression unreadable. "I have a simple question. Why?"

Her whole head turned and faced him. All her scars, her black markings, and scales; and for all these things, her face was flawless. Not a mark, not a blemish, only sparkling sapphire eyes with a piercing hairline pupil. "What why?"

"Why do that to yourself, all to save a girl you've never met." He half expected her to snort, but Sava didn't even growl.

"Little girl curious, only having fun. Didn't want to hurt her."

"I see. You know, you are not the first dragonkin I've met." This definitely caught her attention, even her expression showed surprise. "He was a vicious brute. Never seen anything take so much sadistic pleasure in killing. But at the end of every day, I would find him crying." This made Sava scoff, but she still seemed keen on listening.

"The dragon in him yearned for blood and death, but the small child he had once been still lived. And every night that little boy wept not for himself, but for the people he hurt." Taking a poker in hand, Tristan set aside a moment's break to shift a log. Sava seemed a little annoyed, she was interested.

"This kin, he only ever showed me this side of him. Any other would have been torn apart, but not I. It was a wonder for me as to why this was. But what I saw today answered a question that has plagued me for many years. Just like the kin I knew when I was very young, you would have let yourself die rather than harm a child. I was a small boy at that time, he a fair deal older. I'd have died if it were not for him. And in the end, it was he that gave up his life so I could live on."

"Why."

"That question has burned a hole in my heart. I may never know his reason."

"No. Why you know a kin. You are son of master. Live in this place. Talk of killing... knowing kin. Why? How?" The faint grin the pulled at the edges of Tristan's mouth were sincere as he set down his poker and pulled back the collar of his shirt. Around his neck was a burn scar, perfectly shaped. The shape itself was the most surprising, and Sava found her hand unconsciously reaching for her own neck. The scar as in the same place and was the same shape as her collar. A slave collar.

"I'm not his son. I'm adopted. I was raised in the slave pits of Terr'Duga as fodder for the gladiators. It would have been a short life if not for the kin there." The young man's expression became forlorn, his eyes closed in thought. "My real father had sold me to that retched place. The same place a dragonkin gave his life for me to escape from. And now what do I see today but a dragonkin nearly give up her own life just to save a child from harm."

He took that moment to stand, Sava's head following him as he brushed himself down. "What my adopted mother says may be true to some, but I know the differences. Dragonkin are noble in ways most men cannot fathom. You proved that to me today just as he did years back. What I said to my parents before is one thing, but this is something I feel I must do."

Despite every instinct screaming for her to move, Sava forced herself to remain still as Tristan came to kneel right beside her. "I cannot, for everything I have lived for, allow this to continue. You do not deserve what fate has dealt. I cannot changed what has occured, but I can choose what will." His hands rose and grasped the collar around Sava's neck. She stiffened, eyes wide as saucers. She could feel him looking for the clasp, something only a person not attached to it could use. He was going to remove the collar!

Her heartbeat began to quicken, the excitement very strong as so many thoughts rushed through her head. She would be free again. Free to fly, to run, to return home! Home... she didn't even know what direction it was in. She just knew it had been mountainous. Searching every mountain and crag would be hopeless. She had already resigned that she would never see that place again.

But she would still be free! Her claws twitched at the image of the moment the collar's power was released. Sinking her fangs into the first thing she could, spilling blood and innards and shrieking her triumph. Sava blinked, the image played over and over as suppressed instinct bubbled within her like boiling water about to overflow. She knew the second that collar was off, fury and rage unbound would crash like a tidal wave.

But, through the maelstrom of bloodlust and anger, a voice cried out in Sava's mind. It was an unfamiliar one, but somehow she knew it had always been there. The voice pleaded, and even through the images Sava understood. Her hands raced up and grabbed Tristan's wrists, surprising him. "No. Leave it."

"What?"

"Leave it. Made up mind. No home to go back to, no place else. Stay here."

"Then at least let me-"

"No. Leave it on." Her words did not sound like a demand... they were a plea. She was begging him. It took Tristan a moment, but he finally relented.

"If that is what you wish. I will honor that. But I promise you, you will have a home here."

Sava nodded, returning her gaze to the flames.

(You, Sava, Guard (for this chapter only) and Satsuki)

The guard led Sava towards the group of people that was waiting near the tent that housed the other slaves that would be sold, which was far from the crowd, so as to avoid thievery. Once they got there,the leader of the group took of the hood that covered his head and the upper part of the shoulder part of the armor he was wearing. Sava noticed that the armor was white in color, except for the borders of each piece of said armor, which were black. Sava then looked at the man himself. He was quite young, a teenager probably. He had big eyes that were sapphire blue in color. She found that odd because it was a very rare color of eyes. He also had short black hair that ended in what looked like three spiked inverted waves on the front side of his head. All of the tips pointed left. The next thing she noticed was that, if the armors size and shape were any indicators, his body was quite well built. She also noticed the sword and two medium sized bags he had attached to his armors belt. This mas was most likely from royalty. When the guard was in front of him, he extended his hand to claim the bidden value.

"The money, please, sir. I can only hand it to you after I receive the accorded sum. ", the guard said, smiling with malice, while looking at Sava. He knew that she hated being called "it".

The man, Sava noticed, didn't looked amused at all. Heck, if she had to guess, she'd say that he was angered by the guards comment. Although she could be wrong, since he tried to keep as serious as possible.

"Of course. I understand.", he said in a cold voice that sent shivers down both, the guards and Sava's spines.

He then grabbed the two bags.

"Here you go, guard. Thank you for bringing HER to me."

Had he called her "her"? Maybe she was right and he indeed was angered at what the guard had said?

"N-no sir, I'm the one w-who should be thankful."

The guard was obviously afraid of the tone in the young man's voice. Yet, he questioned him."

"S-sir. I may be out of place by saying this but, this is a dragon, it does not have feelings nor the capacity to think or act in a rational way. So, I think it would be wiser to call this thing an "it"."

Sava was outraged by what this guard was saying. And, had the collar allowed it, she would be also enraged and would have killed the guard already. But, to her surprise, the man who had bought her punched the guard's face and sent him a few good meters away. If Sava had to guess, it was somewhere between 50 to 60 meters. When the guard landed, a *CRACK* sound was head, meaning that something had broken. The guard, who now was bleeding, looked in shock, confusion and fear upon the man that was standing in front of him.

"How dare you."

Said the young man in a tone that surprised the guard and Sava. For it carried a lot or anger on it, and the glare he was giving the guard was so intense that Sava felt like he was staring at the guard's very soul.

"How dare you speak of HER like that! SHE is a sentient being, like you, me and everyone else in this or any other place. SHE CAN feel and SHE CAN think rationally. Hell, she can think more rationally that many humans here! Dragons are wise and beautiful creatures and should be treated with respect! Also, she is mine now. And if you talk like that about HER again, you'll be dead before you can blink, was I clear?", said the young man loudly, but not loud enough to alert the other people.

The guard couldn't answer. He was trying to process the situation. But the man was loosing his patience.

"I asked, WAS, I, CLEAR?"

This time, the guard answered.

"Y-yes, sir. Y-you couldn't have been more clear. T-then, excuse me."

The guard the began to half walk, half crawl back to his post. The man then turned to Sava. Surprisingly though, he was calm and smiling in a kind way.

"I apologize for this scene.", he said getting closer, until he was standing in front of Sava. "My name is Leon." he said, bowing. "What is yours, miss?"

*Miss?* "My name is Sava."

He then extended his hand.

"Nice to meet you."

Sava then took the man's hand and shook it.

"I wish I could say the same."

"I know this looks bad. But you don't need to worry. It won't last long"

"Liar. I'm going to be a slave for the rest of my life. Why wouldn't I have to worry?"

"I'm not lying. I'm not going to keep you as a slave."

"What?! Then, why did you bought me?!", asked Sava, utterly confused.

"I can't tell you here. I'll tell you once we get to my place, where we wont be heard by malicious ears."

He then turned to the men that where behind him.

"I'll take her. I trust you to keep the good job."

He then spoke to the hooded figure at his left.

"Okay, Satsuki. You'll lead them and we'll meet back at the rendezvous point, alright?"

"Yes, Leon.", said a female voice.

Leon and Sava then went to the gates and, once the gates were closed and they were at about 100 meters away Leon told Sava that now they could go calmly to where he would meet the others after they were done.

What is the rendezvous point?

The kind of forest that you had to know your way around, or you could get lost and take ages to find the exit, provided that some of the dangerous inhabitants of the forest didn't got you first. "To remove the collar."

"You can do that?!"

"Because it requires magic. And if had used magic near the market, where we were in plain view, I would have drawn attention and I would be watched every time I went to that place, thus, jeopardizing future missions."

Also, that collar, as well as the "status" of slave, if it can be called that, is already humiliating, but for dragons, who are prideful creatures, it's even more so. Am I right?"

"Y-yes. A-all of it is true.", by now, Sava had turned around and was sniffing and on the verge of tears.

Even tough this man was kind to her, like he said, dragons are prideful by nature, thus, she didn't wanted him or anyone else to see her crying. Then, to her surprise, she felt two strong and armored arms, which she knew that belonged to Leon, after all, they were the only two persons there, wraping around her belly and hugging her from behind.

"It's okay, Sava. Altough I can't know your pain, as I have never been a slave, I CAN imagine how all of that horrendous experience must have hurt. Being sparated from your family, not knowing where you are and always wondering about what will be your fate. But don't worry, my friends and I won't let nor you nor anyone suffer that fate ever again. Not if we can help it, my friend."

Sava couldn't help it anymore. She turned to face Leon, tears running down her cheecks freely, and hugged the man back with all of her might. At that moment, Leon, while appreciatting the hug, was happy that he was wearing armor.

"T-thank you, Leon. Thank you so much! You don't know how much those words mean to me! It's meen so long since anyone has trated me kindly, with respect and as an equal..."

"Shh. It's okay. Let it all out."

And so, they stood there. Leon being Sava's support and Sava happy that, after a long, long time, she had someone to call friend.

-Meanwhile, back at the market-

Satsuki was a quite young woman. She had 18 years old. But she already knew how life around here went. And she didn't liked how the nobles treated the other, like they were property. Unfortunately, also to not raise suspicion, they had a limit of three to four slaves per member. After the purchases were done and the quota had been reached, each member and their temporary slaves were to exit the market and go to the rendezvous point through different routes. Making it difficult for anyone who dared to follow them to reach their place or to identify them in future missions. Satsuki had gotten lucky. She had managed to complete her quota and was already on her way to the meeting point with four slaves behind her. One male and three females. The male was an uncommon one. He has an "incomplete" Incubus. He was incomplete because he had managed to escape his Succubus mistress control befor he lost all of his humanity, altough he had some demonic traits, like a tail that ended in an arrow shape, two small horns, small bat-like wings, too small to fly, and his skin was somewhat darker that the usual tone. His name was Jack. The females were all of diferent kinds. Their names were Yuki, Luchia and Fleur. Yuki appeared like a normal teenager girl, but in reality, she was a vampire. She had shoulder lenght black, straight hair, pale skin, was 5'2'' tall and piercing red eyes that gained a black slit in the middle when she was angry. She appeared to be 15, but, being that vapires are immortal, god knew what her true age was. Seira was a mermaid. Altough she was human now, whenever she was on the water or simply got wet, her leges would turn into her mermaid lower half. Her mermaid tail was a beautiful orange color, her hair was almost completely straight but ended in upward waves and was also orange colored. She was 18 years old and her height, when human, was 6'0'' and when mermaid, it was 6'5''. Her eyes were black on the outside and had orange pupils. Finally, Fleur was the rarest of all. But she appeared to be in the early 20's. Her skin, or rather, her fur, was white as snow, her eyes, a peculiar baby pink, her horn, long and majestic, indicating her status and power, was currently with a non-maigic ring around it, nullyfying any attempt at magic she could try. Her mane and tail had traces of baby pink and violet. Another curious thing about Fleur, was that she wasn't a regular Unicor, she was an anthro. Meaning that she had Unicorn body but stood and walked on two legs, like humans. Her height, counting with her horn, was 6'8''.

"Okay, everyone. Listed up. I know you all must think that I some vile person who bought you fot her pleasure, prestige and all that stuff."

"Of course! Why would you buy us other wise?!"

"That's right! You humans are all the same!"

"I agree. All you want is power."

Jack only grunted and gave a nod. Signaling that he agreed with the girls.

"That's not true at all."

"Oh? How so?", Jack spoke for the first time."

"I'm not gonna keep-"

"What?!"

Sava and Leon had resumed walking a few minutes ago, after Sava had calmed down. She was feeling lighter, as if a great weight had been lifted of her chest and had a better opinion on Leon. "Well, I have met dragons before, both, male and female. Also, when I was a kid, the village where I lived in had a strong relationship with a dragon clan that was nearby. We protected each other and were in quite friendly terms."

Chiani simply shut her eyes and let out a slow breath as the barker tried to regain the attention of his crowd as some distraction broke out. She wore barely anything just to show off her skin and body. Sapphire scales so small they appeared like glossy skin, she'd been washed thoroughly to make sure they shone. The scrubbing had left the fins lining her arms, back, and legs very sore, enough to leave her battling back tears... situation notwithstanding.

Collared, cold, and frightened... her family would have been proud of her for such composure. Every cold breeze made her antenna twitch and her knees creak. "If I may have your attention back ladies and gentlemen... for a first among my items, I have a Meriad. No, I assure you all she is the genuine article."

"Meriads have fish tails instead of legs!" Someone yelled from the crowd. It made a burst of hot anger flit through Chiani's veins. To suggest she was anything like a fish was insulting. She did not suggest humans and the like were related to cattle. Once again she was forced to calm her mind, anger would achieve nothing.

"As you can see good sir, her tail is the source of such rumor." The barker put a hand underneath Chiani's tail and lifted it, making her stiffen... it was her only covering on that side. "See how it flattens, much like an incredibly long fin? This is where such rumors arose." The barker's hand slid down the side of Chiani's tail, making her shudder again. "As you all can very well see, it is a choice example of a truly rare people. I will start the bidding at ten thousand riol."

It had only been a few weeks that Chiani had been stolen from the water's warm embrace and thrust into such a hopeless destiny... but she had never been so frightened as to just how many hands went up to secure her as a prize. The price skyrocketed, and soon only a few hands continued to move. Finally, it came down to two. One was of regal bearing, the other dressed as one would to travel a long way. Chiani did not have the chance to give it further thought when only one hand remained in the air. "Sold for twenty-one thousand riol!"

Chiani knew what this meant. As long as she wore the collar she was forced to obey. All she could do was stare at her buyer. The guards took the chain and led her down the stairs and to her new master...
